page.title: 07BRINGSTYE HONEY FARM.
page.content: Mr.R.May has had a {honey farm} near Blakedown for about 15 years and needs to harvest 10 tons of honey before making any profit.He has been interested in bees since the age of 15 and now has 400 hives spread over Staffordshire,Hereford & Worcester and Shropshire.At the height of the season each hive can be occupied by 40 to 50 thousand bees. Summer is a busy time for Mr.May but much effort is required throughout the year.After extracting the honey in July & August the bees have to be fed sugar and water as food for the Winter Wasps can be a menace robbing and destroying weaker colonies.Winter is spent mending and making hives and equipment for the Spring when there are constant checks that all is well. Mr.May recently removed a large swarm from a shop window in Kidd.
